comments.body: Good point; think it should be http://www.netlib.org/f2c/src.tgz (per https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F2c).

Except it looks like we probably also need http://www.netlib.org/f2c/libf2c.zip, which isn't in `src.tgz`...and conda-build 2 doesn't support multiple sources. So I think options are:

1) Stick to this redistribution from the Sandia mirror, with the same content as netlib.org.
2) Download libf2c.zip (and checksum it) in the build script.
3) Wait for conda-forge to migrate to cb3.
4) Package libf77 and libi77 separately and have f2c depend on them. Not sure if f2c will directly work that way / if there are any other changes in them to libf2c.zip.

None of these seem ideal, but 1 is probably easiest and good-enough?

yes, that's exactly the reason why I am using the mirror. It is the only place where you can get the whole thing at once.

The only other option I see is to split into two packages (`f2c` and `libf2c`) each one with its own source, but that doesn't seem ideal to me given that you cannot use a program compiled with `f2c` without `libf2c`.
